info.name: Official Wrike Collection v 2.1
info.description:
Use the collection as a reference to the official [API documentation](https://developers.wrike.com/)documentation/

Once imported you should create an environment with two variables.

APIToken containing your Wrike API Token 
WrikeAPI containing the API URL Base like 
* https://www.wrike.com/api/v4
* https://eu-app.wrike.com/api/v4

request.description:
This API call will get the authenticated users record

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/contacts/#query-contacts

The API call will get all contact records in Wrike. This includes user records and groups.

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/contacts/#query-contacts

This API call will get information about a specifc user or group in Wrike. Options are to get metadata and the ID of the associated work schedule

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/contacts/#query-contacts

This API call will update the meta data on the user contact record. Be aware that the meta data record can only be accessed by the user self.

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/contacts/#modify-contact

This API method will get details about a specific User. You can get the ID using the Contacts methods

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/users/#query-user

This API method can update a user account on specific Wrike Account, with a specific Role (User or Collaborator) and you can toggle the user between regular and collborator. 

The included example updates the user KUAH2VZU on account IEACW7SV. The user is made a external user (role=user and external=true)

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/users/#modify-user

This API call will get all groups in Wrike

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/groups/#query-groups

This API call will get a specific group in Wrike

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/groups/#query-groups

This API call will create a new group Wrike named "New Group" with a single member "KUAH2VZU". 
The group will be a sub-group to "KX73D4KC". 
The group avatar will be "01" with a very light green color. 
It will have a metadata key named "foreignKey" with the value "100"

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/groups/#create-groups

This API call will update the group Wrike with ID "KX73B4IV"
 
The name of the group will be "Old Group" and two new members will be added ("KUAFY3BJ" and "KUAHUBHL")
The group avatar will be updated to be "02" with a sharp pink color. 
The meta data key "foreignKey" will be created or updated with the value "200"

It is also possible to add/update a parent group. In this example the parameter is turned off

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/groups/#modify-groups

This API call will update the group Wrike with ID "KX73B4IV"
 
The name of the group will be "Old Group" and two new members will be added ("KUAFY3BJ" and "KUAHUBHL")
The group avatar will be updated to be "02" with a sharp pink color. 
The meta data key "foreignKey" will be created or updated with the value "200"

It is also possible to add/update a parent group. In this example the parameter is turned off

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/groups/#modify-groups

Check if the group "KX73B4IV" can be deleted

If the group cannot be deleted the error value "not_allowed" will be returned.

If the group can be deleted no error will be deleted.

This will NOT delete the group

http://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/groups/#delete-groups

Delete the group "KX73B4IV"

http://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/groups/#delete-groups

Get all invitations

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/invitations/#query-invitations

query.value: Here is your personal invitation to our Wrike account

request.description:
Send a new invitation to email carl.stevens@example.com. The invitation is for user to join as external user

If you are on a paid account you can customize subject and message send to the user (disabled in this example)

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/invitations/#query-invitations

When you update an invitation, you can elect to resend the invitation with the parameter "resend"

In the same update you can also update the role to either "user" or "collaborator". 
If you update to "user" you can also troggle between "regular" or "external" user by setting the "external" parameter "true" or "false"

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/invitations/#update-invitation

You can delete the invitation by simply providing the IP

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/invitations/#delete-invitation

Get all workflows in the account

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/workflows/#query-workflows

Create a new workflow with the name "New Workflow"

It will be create with an Active and Completed workflow status

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/workflows/#create-workflow

query.description: Optional and will only add new states

request.description:
Update the workflow. You can update the Name, add new workflow states and toggle the hidden flag which will hide the workflow in the Wrike UI

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/workflows/#query-workflows

Get all custom fields

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/custom-fields/#query-custom-fields

Get details of custom fields. Provide IDs in a list (up to 100 IDs)

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/custom-fields/#query-custom-fields

Create a new custom field. This can be simple or complex. Check documentation for details on the parameter settings

In this example, create new new custom field with the name "New Custom Field" with the type "DropDown". 

The custom field is shared with two users [KUAH2VZU,KUAFY3BJ] and applies to Projects only.

The values of the dropdown is [A,B,C] and users are allowed to provide other values as well.

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/custom-fields/#create-custom-field

Modify existin custom field. This can be simple or complex. Check documentation for details on the parameter settings

In this example, the custom field gets the name "Old Custom Field" and the type is updated to "DropDown". 

The custom field is shared with addtional two users [KUAGQUT3,KUAH3CJL] and user [KUAH2VZU] is removed.

The settings are not updated but can be.

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/custom-fields/#modify-custom-field

Delete a custom field.

This is a hidden API Method and is not documented in the official API documentation

Be very careful when using this method. It will remove not only the custom field but also the data stored in them. There is not ability to restore any of this

item.name: Get Folder Tree (Account) by meta data

query.description: Optional (true for search in recycle bin)

request.description:
Get all Projects (Project true) on the account (descendants true) where a meta key "foreignKey" contains the value "200"

Do not search in the recycle bin and return all possible fields

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#get-folder-tree

item.name: Get Folder Tree (Space) by updated Date

request.description:
Get all Folders (Project false) on the account (descendants true) that was updated between

{"start":"2020-06-01T00:00:00Z","end":"2020-06-29T13:11:22Z"}

Return all possible fields

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#get-folder-tree

item.name: Get Folder Tree (Folder) by custom field

request.description:
Get all Folders/Projects under [IEACW7SVI4PMYIO6] (descendants true) where the value of custom field [IEACW7SVJUABJLU7] is [EqualTo] "Foster Brewing"

Return all possible fields

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#get-folder-tree

Get folder by permalink

This is a very efficient way to get from the Wrike UI to the API. If you want to find the specific folder or project you are using in the Wrike UI simple turn the permalink into a Wrike API ID

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#get-folder-tree

Get folder/project by ID

Return all possible values

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#get-folder-tree

Create a new Project with the name "New Project" and a short description

The Project is shared with the users [KUAH2VZU,KUAFY3BJ] and has to meta keys [foreignKey, foreignKey2]

The project owner is [KUAFY3BJ] and runs from 01/07 to 30/11. The status of the project is [IEACW7SVJMBJA6SI] and is non-billable

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#create-folder

Create a new Folder with the name "New Folder" and a short description

The Folder is shared with the users [KUAH2VZU,KUAFY3BJ] and has to meta keys [foreignKey, foreignKey2]

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#create-folder

Update project name to "New Project 2" and the description.

Add a parent folder [IEACW7SVI4MGTQJQ] and share with additionally one user [KUAGQUTS]

Unshare the folder with two users [KUAGQU3I,KUAH2VZU] and add two meta keys to the project

Update the project owner, status and start/end date as well

Add contractType to the return result

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#modify-folder

Update project name to "New Project 2" and the description.

Add a parent folder [IEACW7SVI4MGTQJQ] and share with additionally one user [KUAGQUTS]

Unshare the folder with two users [KUAGQU3I,KUAH2VZU] and add two meta keys to the project

Update the project owner, status and start/end date as well

Add contractType to the return result

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#modify-folder

Update folder name to "New Folder 2" and the description.

Remove the folder from the parent folder/project [IEACW7SVI4MGTQJQ]

Share the folder with two users [KUAGQU3I,KUAH2VZU] and add/update the custom field [IEACW7SVJUABJLU7] to the value "GlenCorp"

Add contractType to the return result

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#modify-folder

item.name: Mass Update Custom Fields on Folders/Projects

request.description:
Mass update up to 100 folders/projects with a single call. You can add or update the values of custom fields

The example updates a single custom field value on 3 folders/projects

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#modify-folder

Delete the folder

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#delete-folder

query.description: Optional (most likely false else it will be tagged to your template folder)

request.description:
Copy Folder is the equivilent of the duplication in the Wrike UI

The parameters mostly follows what you can do in the UI

The example here creates a copy of the project [IEACW7SVI4OMYHGQ] and places the duplicate in the folder [IEACW7SVI4PMYIO6]

The new project will be named "New Project from Template" and all tasks/folders will be prefix'ed with "NPFT"

Include descriptions, responsibled, custom fields and custom statuses in the new copy

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#copy-folder

query.description: Optional (most likely false else it will be tagged to your template folder)

request.description:
Copy Folder is the equivilent of the duplication in the Wrike UI

The parameters mostly follows what you can do in the UI

The example here creates a copy of the project [IEACW7SVI4OMYHGQ] and places the duplicate in the folder [IEACW7SVI4PMYIO6]

The new project will be named "New Project from Template" and all tasks/folders will be prefix'ed with "NPFT"

Include descriptions, responsibled, custom fields and custom statuses in the new copy

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#copy-folder

Get task by permalink

This is a very efficient way to get from the Wrike UI to the API. If you want to find the specific task are using in the Wrike UI simple turn the permalink into a Wrike API ID

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#query-tasks

Get task information by ID

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#query-tasks

query.description: Optional (effortAllocation is only supported with Wrike Resource)

request.description:
Get multiple tasks by comma separated IDs

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#query-tasks

item.name: Query Tasks in the entire account

request.description:
Search for tasks in the entire account

The result will only include tasks that is shared with the authenticated user (determined by the API Token)

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#query-tasks

item.name: Query Tasks in a specific Space

request.description:
Search for tasks in a specific space

The result will only include tasks that is shared with the authenticated user (determined by the API Token)

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#query-tasks

item.name: Query Tasks in a specific Folder/Project

request.description:
Search for tasks in a specific Folder or Project

The result will only include tasks that is shared with the authenticated user (determined by the API Token)

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#query-tasks

item.name: Get All Tasks & Subtasks in a specific Folder/Project

request.description:
Search for tasks in a specific Folder or Project

The result will only include tasks that is shared with the authenticated user (determined by the API Token)

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#query-tasks

url.raw:
{{WrikeAPI}}/folders/IEACW7SVI4OMYHGQ/tasks?title=New Subtask&description=This is a longer description
You can also include HTML&importance=Normal&superTasks=[IEACW7SVKQPZDS4M]&customStatus=IEACW7SVJMAAAAAA&fields=[billingType]

query.value:
This is a longer description
You can also include HTML

request.description:
Create a new task in a folder

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#create-task

query.value:
This is a longer description
You can also include HTML

query.description: Optional (only if customStatus is not set)

request.description:
Create a new task in a folder

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#create-task

item.name: Create Task in folder with duration based schedule, effort and billingType

url.raw:
{{WrikeAPI}}/folders/IEACW7SVI4OMYHGQ/tasks?title=New Task with Effort&description=This is a longer description
You can also include HTML&status=Active&importance=Normal&dates={"type":"Planned","start":"2020-07-07","duration":240}&effortAllocation={"mode":"Basic","totalEffort":240}&billingType=Billable&fields=[effortAllocation,billingType]

query.value:
This is a longer description
You can also include HTML

query.description: Optional (only if customStatus is not set)

request.description:
Create a new task in a folder

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#create-task

url.raw:
{{WrikeAPI}}/folders/IEACW7SVI4OMYHGQ/tasks?title=New Task with Effort 2&description=This is a longer description
You can also include HTML&status=Active&importance=Normal&dates={"type":"Planned","start":"2020-07-07","due":"2020-07-08"}&effortAllocation={"mode":"Basic","totalEffort":240}&billingType=Billable&fields=[effortAllocation,billingType]

query.value:
This is a longer description
You can also include HTML

query.description: Optional (only if customStatus is not set)

request.description:
Create a new task in a folder

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#create-task

url.raw:
{{WrikeAPI}}/folders/IEACW7SVI4OMYHGQ/tasks?title=New Milestone&description=This is a longer description
You can also include HTML&status=Active&importance=Normal&dates={"type":"Milestone","due":"2020-07-08"}

query.value:
This is a longer description
You can also include HTML

query.description: Optional (only if customStatus is not set)

request.description:
Create a new task in a folder

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#create-task

query.value:
This is an even longer description
You can also include HTML and some formatiing

request.description:
Update Task by ID. You can update a lot of different parts of the task this way.

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#modify-tasks

item.name: Update Multiple Tasks Custom Field Values

request.description:
Update multiple tasks separated by comma. You can update custom fields and effort allocation (not included in this example)

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#modify-tasks

Delete task by ID

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#delete-tasks

request.description:

item.name: Create Comments on Folder or Project

url.raw: {{WrikeAPI}}/folders/IEACW7SVI4OMYHGQ/comments?text=This is a new comment with> HTML formatting&plainText=false

query.value: This is a new comment with> HTML formatting

request.description:
Create a comment on a folder or project

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/comments/#create-comment

url.raw: {{WrikeAPI}}/tasks/IEACW7SVKQPX4WGU/comments?text=This is a new comment with> HTML formatting&plainText=false

request.description:
Create a comment on a task

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/comments/#create-comment

item.name: Create Comments on Task with mention

url.raw: {{WrikeAPI}}/tasks/IEACW7SVKQPX4WGU/comments?text=This is a new comment to @John Doe&plainText=false

query.value: This is a new comment to @John Doe

request.description:
Create a comment on a task with @mention

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/comments/#create-comment

url.raw: {{WrikeAPI}}/comments/IEACW7SVIMJVSFUF?text=This is a new comment to @John Dole&plainText=false

query.value: This is a new comment to @John Dole

request.description:
Update a specific comment

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/comments/#update-comment

Update a specific comment

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/comments/#delete-comment

Get all dependencies for a specific task

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/dependencies/#query-dependencies

Get details for up to 100 dependencies

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/dependencies/#query-dependencies

query.description: Required (Only one of predecessorId or successorId can be used)
Required (Only one of predecessorId or successorId can be used)

request.description:
Create a new dependency on a task

Provide relationType and one of predecessorId or successorId

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/dependencies/#create-dependency

Modify a specific dependency and change the relationType

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/dependencies/#modify-dependency

Delete a dependency

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/dependencies/#delete-dependency

Get all timelogs 
* shared with authenticated user (no further changes)
* for specific user (add /contacts/<contactid>) - see example below
* in specific folder (add /folders/<folderid>)
* in specific task (add /tasks/<taskid>)
* for a specific timelog category (add /timelog_categories/<timelog_category_id>) - see example below

You can filter on billingType of you have Wrike Resource and add billingType to the return result by adding "fields = [billingType]"

If you want to get the timelogs for the current authenticated user, simply replace the contact ID with me - similar to the Query Contacts method

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/timelogs/#query-timelogs

Get all timelogs for a specific Contact (user)

You can filter on billingType of you have Wrike Resource and add billingType to the return result by adding "fields = [billingType]"

If you want to get the timelogs for the current authenticated user, simply replace the contact ID with me - similar to the Query Contacts method

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/timelogs/#query-timelogs

Get all timelogs 
* shared with authenticated user (no further changes)
* for specific user (see next example)
* in specific folder (add /folders/<folderid>)
* in specific task (add /tasks/<taskid>)

You can filter on billingType of you have Wrike Resource and add billingType to the return result by adding "fields = [billingType]"

If you want to get the timelogs for the current authenticated user, simply replace the contact ID with me - similar to the Query Contacts method

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/timelogs/#query-timelogs

item.name: Query Timelog for Task by ID

request.description:
Get all timelogs for Task

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/timelogs/#query-timelogs

item.name: Query Timelog for Task by ID where export status is ReadyForExport (WR)

request.description:
Get all timelogs for Task where [exportStatus] is [ReadyForExport]

This is only supported if you have Wrike Resource

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/timelogs/#query-timelogs

item.name: Query Timelog for Task by ID (WR)

request.description:
Get all timelogs for Task and include [exportStatus]

This is only supported if you have Wrike Resource

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/timelogs/#query-timelogs

Create a new timelog entry on a task

If you have Wrike Resource, you can add billingType to the result set. See below

You can only create timelog entries for the currently authenticated user

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/timelogs/#modify-timelog

item.name: Update Export Status of Timelog Entry (WR)

request.description:
Update the export status of a timelog entry

This is only supported if you have Wrike Resource

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/timelogs/#modify-timelog

item.name: Update number of hours of Timelog Entry

request.description:
Update the reported number of hours of a timelog entry

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/timelogs/#modify-timelog

Delete a timelog entry

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/timelogs/#delete-timelog

Get a list of all timelog categories

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/timelog-categories/#query-timelog-categories

Get all attachments

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/attachments/#get-attachments

item.name: Get Attachments on Folder or Project

request.description:
Get all attachments on a folder or project

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/attachments/#get-attachments

Get all attachments on a Task

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/attachments/#get-attachments

Get details of one or more attachments

For more attachments add comma separated list. Up to 100 IDs

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/attachments/#get-attachments

Download the attachment content. 

In this example the contant will be downloaded with "Lorem Ipsum.docx" as the name of the file

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/attachments/#get-attachments

Download the attachment preview. 

The example will be created as Content-Type 'image/png' and filename will be set as screenshot.jpeg

The preview will be 300px wide and hight will be auto

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/attachments/#download-attachment-preview

Get the access url that can be used to download the attachment

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/attachments/#get-access-url-for-attachment

Create a new attachment on a Wrike task

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/attachments/#create-wrike-attachment

item.name: Create Wrike Attachment on Folder or Project

request.description:
Create a new attachment on a Wrike folder or project

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/attachments/#create-wrike-attachment

Update an existing Wrike attachment with a new version

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/attachments/#update-attachment

Delete an existing Wrike attachment

Be aware, the attachment **cannot** be recovered from the recycle bin. 


https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/attachments/#delete-attachment

Get the current API Version of the API

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/version/#api-version

Convert the V2 IDs used in the UI to the V4 IDs used by the API

Change the type to match the type of object you are looking to comverts. You can convert multiple IDs by providing a comma separated list of IDs

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/ids/#legacy-api-v2-ids-converter

Get the color name - code mapping

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/colors/#query-colors

Get a list of all spaces visible to the authenticated user

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/spaces/#get-spaces

Get Space information by Space ID   

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/spaces/#get-space

Get Space information by Space ID   

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/spaces/#get-space

Update a specific Space

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/spaces/#update-space

Update a specific Space

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/spaces/#update-space

Get the last completed Data Export

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/data-export/#get-data-export

Get a specific Data Export

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/data-export/#get-data-export

Force a new data export generation (if it is not in progress already). 
* 202 code is returned in case new export generation is started. 
* Data export can be requested no sooner than 1 hour after last successful data export. 
* If there is fresh data export already, 200 code and latest export in format similar to [GET] /data_export is returned.

(https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/data-export/#refresh-data-export)

Get data export schema specified by version.

(https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/data-export/#get-data-export-schema)

Get [Audit Log Reports](https://help.wrike.com/hc/en-us/articles/209606309-Audit-Log-Reports), that contains audit trail for actions in the account. Available to Enterprise admins with "Create user activity reports" right.

(https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/audit-log/#get-audit-log)

Get a list of all access roles

(https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/access-roles/#get-access-roles)

Get the status of an asynchronos job

Status can be one of [InQueue, InProgress, Completed, Failed]

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/async-job/#get-async-job

Reads approvals by filter. When no filter parameters passed returns all approvals shared with a user.

(https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/approvals/#get-approvals)

item.name: Get Approvals by Folder or Project

request.description:
Reads all approvals on folder/project.

(https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/approvals/#get-approvals)

Reads all approvals on task.

(https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/approvals/#get-approvals)

Reads approvals by ids.

(https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/approvals/#get-approvals)

item.name: Create Approvals on Folder or Project

request.description:
Create an approval for folder/project. Creates approval in draft status when no approvers assigned. Otherwise creates in pending status. Approvals created via API will not be affected by workflow automation, e.g. task status will not be automatically transitioned when approval finishes.

(https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/approvals/#create-approval)

Create an approval for task. Creates approval in draft status when no approvers assigned. Otherwise creates in pending status. Approvals created via API will not be affected by workflow automation, e.g. task status will not be automatically transitioned when approval finishes.

query.value: New Project from Folder Blueprint Async

request.description:
Copy Folder is the equivilent of the duplication in the Wrike UI

The parameters mostly follows what you can do in the UI

The example here creates a copy of the project [IEACW7SVI4OMYHGQ] and places the duplicate in the folder [IEACW7SVI4PMYIO6]

The new project will be named "New Project from Template" and all tasks/folders will be prefix'ed with "NPFT"

Include descriptions, responsibled, custom fields and custom statuses in the new copy

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#copy-folder

query.description: ID of parent task. Set this to add work from the task-based template as a subtask. Either this parameter or parentId is required. parentId and superTaskId cannot be set simultaneously.

ID of parent folder or project. Set this to put work from the template to the specific folder or project. Either this parameter or superTaskId is required. parentId and superTaskId cannot be set simultaneously

request.description:

The new project will be named "New Project from Template" and all tasks/folders will be prefix'ed with "NPFT"

Include descriptions, responsibled, custom fields and custom statuses in the new copy

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/folders-projects/#copy-folder

https://developers.wrike.com/webhooks/

item.name: Create a Webhook on Folder or Project Copy

request.description:
Get a list of all webhooks created using the same API Token

https://developers.wrike.com/webhooks/

Update the state of a webhook

If you shut down your endpoint or it is not accessible via the internet, then we automatically suspend the webhook after 3 retries. 

Call this method with status=Active to enable the Webhook again

https://developers.wrike.com/webhooks/

Delete a webhook permanently

You can only access webhooks created with the same API Token

https://developers.wrike.com/webhooks/

item.name: NextPageToken
Query Tasks in a specific Folder/Project using nextPageToken

query.description: Required (overrides all other parameters in request)

request.description:
Get the next result set page of task

Look out of another nextPageToken which will indicate that you need to continue getting more pages. Continue until you do not have a nextPageToken in the JSON result

The result will only include tasks that is shared with the authenticated user (determined by the API Token)

https://developers.wrike.com/api/v4/tasks/#query-tasks

item.description:
How to use nextPageToken

If you see a nextPageToken in any JSON return results, you need to handle pagination of the result which means the result is containing more items that the allowed pageSize (which for some calls can be controlled) and each API method has a maximum set.

The JSON result will look something like this

{
  "kind": "tasks",
  "nextPageToken": "ABOGYKIAAAAAOAAAAABAAAABOEAAAAACBIJUQHBQA5XRM",
  "responseSize": 369,
  "data": [...]
}

See examples in this folder how to use nextPageToken
